intro: Fimbristylis pallidula, commonly known as the pale threadgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is native to parts of Australia and is often found in coastal areas and saline environments. Fimbristylis pallidula plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
